comment.text: Hexokinase is an allosteric enzyme inhibited by its product Glc-6-P.
Monomer (By similarity). Interacts with TIGAR; the interaction increases hexokinase HK2 activity in a hypoxia- and HIF1A-dependent manner (PubMed:23185017).
Its hydrophobic N-terminal sequence may be involved in membrane binding.
Predominant hexokinase isozyme expressed in insulin-responsive tissues such as skeletal muscle.

The N- and C-terminal halves of this hexokinase show extensive sequence similarity to each other. The catalytic activity is associated with the C-terminus while regulatory function is associated with the N-terminus. Each domain can bind a single glucose and Gluc-6-P molecule.
Although found in NIDDM patients, genetic variations of HK2 do not contribute to the disease (PubMed:7883122, PubMed:7883123).
In vertebrates there are four major glucose-phosphorylating isoenzymes, designated hexokinase I, II, III and IV (glucokinase).

property.value: P:establishment of protein localization to mitochondrion

P:negative regulation of mitochondrial membrane permeability
P:negative regulation of reactive oxygen species metabolic process
P:positive regulation of mitophagy in response to mitochondrial depolarization
